snippet: The Serb nationalist leader, who has cancer of the liver, was offered a chance by a United Nations tribunal to leave The Hague to receive treatment.
abstract: United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague proposes temporary release for Vojislav Seselj, Serbian nationalist leader whose health has seriously deteriorated while awaiting end of his long-running trial; Seselj is charged with inciting others to commit war crimes in Croatia and in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1990s.
lead_paragraph: The Serb nationalist leader, who has cancer of the liver, was offered a chance by a United Nations tribunal to leave The Hague to receive treatment.

headline.main: Vojislav Seselj, on Trial for War Crimes, Is Offered Temporary Release
headline.print_headline: The Hague: Serbian Nationalist Leader With Cancer May be Freed Temporarily

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
